column4: I was using Ubuntu 8.04 then I installed Mandriva 2009, but the "mandriva's lilo" did not have the option to Ubuntu so I tried to add Ubuntu in the "lilo.conf" but I failed then when I restarted my computer I cannot access both systems... What can I do to acess Ubuntu again?
mandriva uses grub just like ubuntu, and by default it has "othe linux" selection
ok, but it didn't appear in the grub
instead of conventional grub, is being used Mandriva's grub
is mandriva grub on mbr and ubunt grub on /dev/sda2 or something like that?
i don't know.. i think mandriva is in "sda6" and ubuntu in "sda2" or the contrary
i just wanna backup 8gbs of files in Ubuntu then reinstall only Ubuntu in my hd
!paste
try adding somthing like this in mandriva grub file http://paste.ubuntu.com/83758/
u'll need to play with the values to suit you, the sda2 part and the 1 and 2 number that goes with hd0
please don't pm me
its easier
lots of mesages here
please
that's how we roll over here
!grub | Pabremer
ok, btw... what can i do to see what's my ubuntu and mandriva partition?
and google something called supergrub, it will boot into anything from anything
then i'll create the "way" to ubuntu and mandriva again in grub
i cannot use supergrub because i dont have any cd
you can boot usb and floppy too http://www.supergrubdisk.org/
